title.value: Deep PDE solvers for subgrid modelling out-of-distribution generalization
title.justification: Provides a clear and concise summary of the work focusing on the main themes: Deep PDE solvers, subgrid modeling, and out-of-distribution generalization.
title.quote: D EEP PDE S OLVERS FOR S UBGRID M ODELLING O UT- OF -D ISTRIBUTION G ENERALIZATION

extractions.description: This paper addresses the specific needs of Climate and Weather Modelling (CWM) using Machine Learning (ML) models for subgrid processes which are too small to be resolved by standard solution methods. It introduces a novel architecture aimed at addressing the particular requirements of CWM models, ensuring out-of-distribution (OOD) generalization and adherence to physical constraints. The proposed model integrates principles from PDE solution operators to improve prediction accuracy and meet these specialized requirements.

type.justification: The paper presents experimentation with a novel architecture, compares it with baseline models, and discusses its performance in terms of prediction accuracy and OOD generalization.
type.quote: In this work, we propose a tractable model problem... we develop and integrate subgrid solvers into our model which maintain accuracy even at reduced grid resolutions.

name.justification: The study specifically focuses on optimizing models for climate and weather applications, addressing their particular demands.
name.quote: Climate and weather modelling (CWM) is an important area where ML models are used for subgrid modelling: making predictions of processes occurring at scales too small to be resolved by standard solution methods.

name.justification: The paper builds upon the structure of PDE solution operators and integrates it within ML models for improved accuracy and generalization.
name.quote: The architecture is based on expert knowledge of the structure of PDE solution operators.

name.justification: Machine learning approaches are integral to the model's development and implementation.
name.quote: Recently, ML approaches have been used to make better approximations of these subgrid processes.

name.justification: The paper presents it as one of the baseline models for comparison purposes.
name.quote: a standard fully connected 2-layer ReLU neural network (FCN).

is_contributed.justification: The FCN model is used as a baseline for comparison and not an original contribution of the paper.
is_contributed.quote: The fully connected network is a simple 2-layer multilayer perceptron with a hidden layer of size 32 and ReLU activation.

is_executed.justification: The FCN model was executed and tested in the experiments within the paper.
is_executed.quote: We conduct the experiments for both our proposed model architecture and for two baseline models which are: (1) a standard fully connected 2-layer ReLU neural network (FCN).

is_compared.justification: The performance of the FCN model was numerically compared to other models in the study.
is_compared.quote: Figure 1 shows the results of the experiments for the fully resolved grid and for different subgrid models in both one and two variables.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is commonly known and does not have a single reference paper.

name.justification: Introduced as one of the baseline models used for comparative analysis.
name.quote: a standard convolutional 2-layer ReLU neural network (ConvN).

is_contributed.justification: The ConvN model is used as a baseline and is not an original contribution of this work.
is_contributed.quote: The convolutional network is a simple 2-layer convolutional neural network with 3 Ã— 3 kernel, ReLU activation, and hidden layer with 16 channels.

is_executed.justification: The ConvN model was executed and tested in the paper's experiments.
is_executed.quote: We conduct the experiments for both our proposed model architecture and for two baseline models which are:... (2) a standard convolutional 2-layer ReLU neural network (ConvN).

is_compared.justification: The paper numerically compared the performance of the ConvN model to other models, including the proposed architecture.
is_compared.quote: We observe that it performs significantly better than the FCN in both in-distribution and out-of-distribution data, but it still underperforms significantly compared to our model.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The ConvN model is widely recognized and does not have a single clear reference.

name.justification: The new architecture introduced by the paper which focuses on out-of-distribution generalization and respecting physical constraints.
name.quote: We propose and develop a novel architecture, which matches or exceeds the performance of standard ML models, and which demonstrably succeeds in OOD generalization.

is_contributed.justification: The proposed model is an original contribution of this work aimed at addressing specific needs of Climate and Weather Modelling.
is_contributed.quote: We propose a tractable model problem which captures key aspects of the CWM problem: learning subgrid PDE solvers from sampled data, which generalize to new data distributions and satisfy physical constraints.

is_executed.justification: The proposed model was executed and validated through experiments presented in the paper.
is_executed.quote: Moreover, we demonstrate that the PDE-inspired architecture generalizes to OOD data.

is_compared.justification: The proposed model's performance is compared with baseline models to highlight its advantages.
is_compared.quote: The main results are presented in the following figures, which are discussed in more detail later.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is an original contribution of this work and does not reference an outside work.

name.justification: The dataset is generated by solving the PDE numerically on a fine grid and then coarsened for various subgrid resolutions for the experiments.
name.quote: The functions u(x, 0) are generated samples with a prescribed Fourier Spectrum. We then obtain the functions u(x, t) by solving the PDE numerically on the fine grid.

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset is generated as part of this work and is not taken from a reference paper.

name.justification: The paper does not specify the use of any particular deep learning libraries for implementing the models.

referenced_paper_title.justification: No specific libraries are mentioned or referenced.
